Supporting Statement Regarding Proposed Orders
(September 12, 2024)
COMES NOW the Respondent, Christopher Blaine McGregor (“Father”), and respectfully submits the
following statement in support of his proposed order and in opposition to the competing proposed
orders submitted by the Petitioner, Brittany Michelle Gilliland (“Mother”):
1. Therapist Selection and Cost Allocation
Mother’s proposed orders designate a specific therapist (Kelly Turner) and mandate that Father share
in the costs of reunification therapy. In contrast, Father’s proposal allows Mother the freedom to select
an independent and certified reunification therapist, but appropriately places the full financial
responsibility on Mother, as she is the party seeking reunification services.
2. Child Advocacy Center Counseling
Mother’s proposals would allow her to attend Child Advocacy Center (CAC) sessions if and when
available. Father’s proposal prioritizes A.K.’s ongoing mental health by requiring that CAC counseling
continue as recommended until deemed unnecessary by the CAC.
3. Weekly Family Meals
Mother’s proposed orders impose rigid weekly Wednesday evening dinners at 6:30 p.m., with a
mandatory make-up meal if canceled. This rigidity fails to account for the realities of school,
extracurricular activities, and work schedules. Father’s proposal instead provides for one weekly family
meal, with flexibility to select a mutually convenient time, and establishes Sunday lunch as a default.
4. Contempt Provision
Mother’s proposed orders include a punitive contempt clause directed solely at Father. Father’s
proposed order omits this provision, reflecting a focus on cooperation and the best interests of the child.
Conclusion
Mother’s proposed orders are punitive, rigid, and place undue financial and logistical burdens on
Father. By contrast, Father’s proposal is reasonable, balanced, and child-centered. WHEREFORE,
Father respectfully requests that this Court adopt his proposed order in full and deny the adoption of the
competing proposals submitted by Mother.
